text: Listen to ‘The Daily’Special edition: The pandemic reaches the president.
‘Sway’ With Kara SwisherAlexander Vindman on his impeachment testimony and more.
The Book Review PodcastHari Kunzru and Ben Macintyre on their new books.
Since a Sept. 26 celebration for Judge Amy Coney Barrett, at least seven attendees have tested positive for the virus.
Outside experts pointed to the therapies as signs that the president’s condition could be serious. His age, weight and gender put him at high risk.
Dr. Conley, who was appointed as President Trump’s physician in 2018, specializes in osteopathic medicine.
The Constitution says the vice president is next in line if the president dies or can no longer serve, but things get murkier from there.
Joe Biden had a negative virus test and is proceeding with events. But President Trump’s hospitalization injected volatility into the race.
The infections were a byproduct, former aides said, of the recklessness and culture of fear in the White House and throughout the administration.
Rather than unifying the country, President Trump’s health crisis is filtered through the partisan lenses that divide Americans on seemingly every issue.
The number of new U.S. cases has been slowly rising. Here is where the country is now.
Poll Finds Voters in Two Crucial States Repelled by Trump’s Debate BehaviorJoe Biden is ahead by seven points in Pennsylvania and five points in Florida, according to a Times/Siena survey.

Virus Diagnosis and Secret Texts Upend a Critical Senate RaceThe North Carolina race is in chaos after the incumbent tested positive for coronavirus and his challenger admitted to sending flirtatious texts.

Why a Pro-Trump Town No Longer Sees Him as a RescuerPortsmouth, Ohio, was struggling in 2016. Now it’s on the rebound. Though still loyal to President Trump, its residents no longer tie their fortunes to him.
U.S. Workers Face Permanent Job Losses as the Virus PersistsSoon, a wave of people will have been out of work for more than six months, the threshold for long-term unemployment.
In Paris in August. Tracing operations in Europe have left the public in the dark about their exposure to the coronavirus. Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times

President Trump, at the Walter Reed military hospital, is “improving,” his doctor said. But his chief of staff said his symptoms were “very concerning.”Former Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, who was with President Trump this week, checked himself into a hospital after testing positive. Here’s the latest.
